alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 4:57AM EST until December 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph, with visibility less than a half mile at times. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant, Western Mineral and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on icy road conditions due to snow cover and wet surfaces rapidly freezing. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree and power line damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be through this evening. Near blizzard conditions are possible. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton
